did.unittitle: Office of the Director of the Physical Plant Records

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: State University of New York at Albany. Office of the Director of the Physical Plant

did.abstract: The collection consists of the records of the University at Albany's Director of the Physical Plant. The records document the administrative functions of the office and the maintenance of the University's building, grounds, motor pool and power plant.
did.physloc: The materials are located onsite in the department.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed in 2018 by Amanda Partridge. Copies of records containing personal information removed during processing.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Web Archives

bioghist.head: Biographical History
bioghist.p: The University at Albany's office of the Physical Plant is a unit within the Office of Facilities Management which is a unit within the Division of Finance and Business. The Department of the Physical Plant is responsible for the operation and maintenance of the buildings and grounds of the University at Albany. During this periond, the Physical Plant had a wide range of responsibilities beyond building and ground maintenance, including maintenance of the motor pool, overseeing the power plant, and construction. They were also responsible for the search and repair of the president's residence.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collections consists of records the University at Albany Office of the Physical Plant. It includes work-orders, recipts and correspondence relating to building and grounds maintenance. Documents activities pertaining to the repair and use of the motor pool, such as receipts and use requests. There are records, including photographs, used in the search and repair of the President's residence. Contains financial documents and long-term bugetary plans as well as minutes from staff meetings. Includes employment rosters and other personnel files. Also, has manuels and conference materials.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Collection
arrangement.p: Original order was reclaimed with the exception of the President's Residence Search and Repair and Budget and Planning Records which were separated into their own series.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: All items in this manuscript group were transferred to the University Libraries, M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is unrestricted.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: This page may contain links to digital objects. Access to these images and the technical capacity to download them does not imply permission for re-use. Digital objects may be used freely for personal reference use, referred to, or linked to from other web sites.
Researchers do not have permission to publish or disseminate material from these collections without permission from an archivist and/or the copyright holder.

The researcher assumes full responsibility for conforming to the laws of copyright. Some materials in these collections may be protected by the U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) and/or by the copyright or neighboring-rights laws of other nations. More information about U.S. Copyright is provided by the Copyright Office. Additionally, re-use may be restricted by terms of University Libraries gift or purchase agreements, donor restrictions, privacy and publicity rights, licensing and trademarks.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Preferred citation for this material is as follows:

Identification of specific item, series, box, folder, Office of Director of The Physical Plant, M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives, University Libraries, University at Albany, State University of New York.

phystech.head: URL

phystech.head: Access Requirements
phystech.p: The item contains web archives preserved as WARC files. They must be access though web archival replay tools such as the "Wayback Machine." The links here direct you to files hosted by the Internet Archive, but you may also request WARC files.

dao.xlink:title: Office of Facilities Management

daodesc.p: Office of Facilities Management

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Meta tag for keywords: We are a unit within the Division of Finance and Business. Our six major departments are Architecture, Engineering, and Construction Management, Space Management and Campus Preservation, Physical Plant and Facility Services, Administrative Services, Energy Management, and Information Technology. The Office of Facilities Management also provides campus customers with service for special events, grounds, maintenance, and craft-specific services. We maintain all official campus mapping and detailed archives concerning the specifications and history of our buildings and grounds.

dao.xlink:title: Office of Facilities Management

daodesc.p: Office of Facilities Management

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Meta tag for keywords: We are a unit within the Division of Finance and Business. Our six major departments are Architecture, Engineering, and Construction Management, Space Management and Campus Preservation, Physical Plant and Facility Services, Administrative Services, Energy Management, and Information Technology. The Office of Facilities Management also provides campus customers with service for special events, grounds, maintenance, and craft-specific services. We maintain all official campus mapping and detailed archives concerning the specifications and history of our buildings and grounds.

Meta tag for description: We are a unit within the Division of Finance and Business. Our six major departments are Architecture, Engineering, and Construction Management, Space Management and Campus Preservation, Physical Plant and Facility Services, Administrative Services, Energy Management, and Information Technology. The Office of Facilities Management also provides campus customers with service for special events, grounds, maintenance, and craft-specific services. We maintain all official campus mapping and detailed archives concerning the specifications and history of our buildings and grounds.
Meta tag for author: Robert Mergen

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Researchers interested in data analysis with web archives may request a WARC file. WARC files are very large and difficult to work with. Your request may take time to process, and we may be unable to deliver your request remotely. Please consult an archivist if you are interested in advanced research with web archives.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Researchers interested in data analysis with web archives may request a WARC file. WARC files are very large and difficult to work with. Your request may take time to process, and we may be unable to deliver your request remotely. Please consult an archivist if you are interested in advanced research with web archives.
